children.value: Organization and Management of General Security

Are dedicated managers  (computer and telecom security, general security in the workplace (documents, fax, telephone), general physical security of the sites and premises) or a designated point of contact (HR for awareness and training, work contracts, user account and access rights management, responsibility for disciplining malicious acts or internal negligence) assigned to all areas of security?
For each security manager, is there a clear definition of the job function detailing, in particular, its objectives, responsibilities and interfaces with other areas concerned with security?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A12","Clause":"Operations security","ObjectiveId":"A12.6","Objective":"Technical vulnerability management","ControlId":"12.6.1","Control":"Management of technical vulnerabilities"}]

children.value: Are security management actions represented on dashboards and regularly reviewed?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A12","Clause":"Operations security","ObjectiveId":"A12.6","Objective":"Technical vulnerability management","ControlId":"12.6.1","Control":"Management of technical vulnerabilities"}]

children.value: Is there a committee or structure bringing together all security managers, from all disciplines, in order to coordinate the various security related actions, take cross decisions, and meet regularly?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A12","Clause":"Operations security","ObjectiveId":"A12.6","Objective":"Technical vulnerability management","ControlId":"12.6.1","Control":"Management of technical vulnerabilities"}]

children.value: Is the approach to security clearly recognized and supported by senior management?
Organization and Supervision of Information Systems Security

Is there a document describing the security policy related to information systems and in particular the organization, management and supervising of security (roles and responsibilities) as well as the fundamental principles underlying information security management?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A5","Clause":"Information Security policies","ObjectiveId":"A5.1","Objective":"Management direction for information security","ControlId":"5.1.1","Control":"Policies for information security"}]

children.value: Is this Security Policy revised, on a regular basis or when major changes are done, to ensure the upholding of its relevancy and efficiency?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A5","Clause":"Information Security policies","ObjectiveId":"A5.1","Objective":"Management direction for information security","ControlId":"5.1.2","Control":"Review of the policies for information security"}]

children.value: Have the structure and organization of the management of information systems security been defined in detail: CISO, local responsibilities and contacts, roles and responsibilities towards operational managers and is this organizational structure in operation?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A6","Clause":"Organization of information security","ObjectiveId":"A6.1","Objective":"Internal organization","ControlId":"6.1.1","Control":"Information security roles and responsibilities"}]

children.value: Has this structure the capacity to alert senior management without delay in the case of a serious incident?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A6","Clause":"Organization of information security","ObjectiveId":"A6.1","Objective":"Internal organization","ControlId":"6.1.1","Control":"Information security roles and responsibilities"}]

children.value: Have the mode of managing security and the decision processes been defined in detail: methodology used (for audit of exposure, risk analysis etc.), associated tools, actors (organization, support, training, expertise, advice etc.)?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A6","Clause":"Organization of information security","ObjectiveId":"A6.1","Objective":"Internal organization","ControlId":"6.1.1","Control":"Information security roles and responsibilities"}]

children.value: Have the respective roles of security managers, operational managers and managers of functional domains (information owners) been clearly defined with regard to final decision making and arbitration?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A6","Clause":"Organization of information security","ObjectiveId":"A6.1","Objective":"Internal organization","ControlId":"6.1.1","Control":"Information security roles and responsibilities"}]

children.value: Has a mode of information systems security management been defined: dashboards (contents and frequency), management structure, orientation and reporting?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A6","Clause":"Organization of information security","ObjectiveId":"A6.1","Objective":"Internal organization","ControlId":"6.1.1","Control":"Information security roles and responsibilities"}]

children.value: Is an annual information systems security plan established which brings together all action plans, means to put in place, planning, budget?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A5","Clause":"Information Security policies","ObjectiveId":"A5.1","Objective":"Management direction for information security","ControlId":"5.1.2","Control":"Review of the policies for information security"}]

children.value: Is the Company`s  Management involved in the organization of the information security, particularly in the development and the approbation of the security policy, responsibilities definition, resource allocation, and the efficiency control of the actions taken?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A6","Clause":"Organization of information security","ObjectiveId":"A6.1","Objective":"Internal organization","ControlId":"6.1.1","Control":"Information security roles and responsibilities"}]

children.value: Is a contact maintained with the concerned authorities regarding information security and crisis situation (Police, Reporting Services, Legal Administration, Firemen, Public Services, etc.) ?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A6","Clause":"Organization of information security","ObjectiveId":"A6.1","Objective":"Internal organization","ControlId":"6.1.3","Control":"Contact with authorities"}]

children.value: Does the organization improve knowledge about best security practices and maintain contacts with interest groups, associations, conferences, etc?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A6","Clause":"Organization of information security","ObjectiveId":"A6.1","Objective":"Internal organization","ControlId":"6.1.4","Control":"Contact with special interest groups"},{"ClauseId":"A12","Clause":"Operations security","ObjectiveId":"A12.6","Objective":"Technical vulnerability management","ControlId":"12.6.1","Control":"Management of technical vulnerabilities"}]

children.value: Are the responsibilities and procedures established to provide quick and efficient solutions to the security incidents?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A16","Clause":"Information security incident management","ObjectiveId":"A16.1","Objective":"Management of information security incidents and improvements","ControlId":"16.1.1","Control":"Responsibilities and procedures"},{"ClauseId":"A16","Clause":"Information security incident management","ObjectiveId":"A16.1","Objective":"Management of information security incidents and improvements","ControlId":"16.1.2","Control":"Reporting information security events"}]

children.value: Is there a procedure for regularly updating organizational documents related to information systems security in line with changing organization structures?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A18","Clause":"Compliance","ObjectiveId":"A18.2","Objective":"Information security reviews","ControlId":"18.2.1","Control":"Independent review of information security"},{"ClauseId":"A12","Clause":"Operations security","ObjectiveId":"A12.6","Objective":"Technical vulnerability management","ControlId":"12.6.1","Control":"Management of technical vulnerabilities"}]

answers.Description: The assumptions on system environment shall be aligned to the CIG.
answers.MEHARI_R_V4: E.g. deployment environment (physical and logical location), network, user access, ...

answers.Description: The contractor shall document the specific hardening steps taken to restrict access to the target system/software.

gasf.value: Take least-disruptive automated actions to suspicious events

answers.Description: The system shall notify [incident response personnel (identified by name and/or by role)] of detected suspicious events and takes [least-disruptive actions to terminate suspicious events].
answers.MEHARI_R_V4: Least-disruptive actions may include, for example, initiating requests for human responses.

answers.Description: The contractor shall report information security events through the TO as fast as possible.
answers.MEHARI_R_V4:
For HSO-G, the [applicable Secops Procedure] also apply.

Examples of securiity events are:
- Unauthorised access to information (access to documentation, access to source code, etc.)
- Unauthorised modification/integrity of the information (modification of source code)
- Security tests results (source code review, unit tests, etc.)
- Risk Analysis results
- Security awareness session status
- Backup, deployment, integration, etc. strategies

children.value: General reporting system and incident management system
Is there an incident reporting system which relays incidents to Information Systems Security correspondents including an incident summary for the CISO?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A16","Clause":"Information security incident management","ObjectiveId":"A16.1","Objective":"Management of information security incidents and improvements","ControlId":"16.1.2","Control":"Reporting information security events"}]

children.value: Does this reporting system include all incidents (operation, development, maintenance, usage of the information system) physical, logical or organizational?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A16","Clause":"Information security incident management","ObjectiveId":"A16.1","Objective":"Management of information security incidents and improvements","ControlId":"16.1.2","Control":"Reporting information security events"}]

children.value: Does this reporting system include malevolent actions and failed attempts to breach security?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A16","Clause":"Information security incident management","ObjectiveId":"A16.1","Objective":"Management of information security incidents and improvements","ControlId":"16.1.2","Control":"Reporting information security events"}]

children.value: Is this reporting system applied in all locations and organizations including subsidiaries?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A16","Clause":"Information security incident management","ObjectiveId":"A16.1","Objective":"Management of information security incidents and improvements","ControlId":"16.1.1","Control":"Responsibilities and procedures"},{"ClauseId":"A16","Clause":"Information security incident management","ObjectiveId":"A16.1","Objective":"Management of information security incidents and improvements","ControlId":"16.1.2","Control":"Reporting information security events"}]

children.value: Are the form and description of incidents recorded in a database enabling continuous improvement as well as easy selective access in order to be able to follow up the resolution of individual incidents?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A16","Clause":"Information security incident management","ObjectiveId":"A16.1","Objective":"Management of information security incidents and improvements","ControlId":"16.1.6","Control":"Learning from information security incidents"}]

children.value: Is the collection of forensic proofs performed each time a legal action is considered?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A16","Clause":"Information security incident management","ObjectiveId":"A16.1","Objective":"Management of information security incidents and improvements","ControlId":"16.1.7","Control":"Collection of evidence"}]

children.value: Is the implementation and updating of the incident management system followed-up using a dashboard and a regular review which are transformed into action plans?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A12","Clause":"Operations security","ObjectiveId":"A12.6","Objective":"Technical vulnerability management","ControlId":"12.6.1","Control":"Management of technical vulnerabilities"}]

answers.MEHARI_R_V4: Least-disruptive actions may include, for example, initiating requests for human responses.

For HSO-G, the [applicable Secops Procedure] also apply.

Examples of securiity events are:
- Unauthorised access to information (access to documentation, access to source code, etc.)

children.value: Organization of audits and audit program

Has the security function communicated to internal auditors (or the structure responsible for internal audits) a reference guide related to the information system security, describing in particular, the obligations of each category of personnel, the mandatory directives and the recommendations?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A12","Clause":"Operations security","ObjectiveId":"A12.7","Objective":"Information systems audit considerations","ControlId":"12.7.1","Control":"Information systems audit controls"}]

children.value: Is the procedure, allowing derogation from internal directives, written into the audit reference documentation and is the procedure auditable?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A12","Clause":"Operations security","ObjectiveId":"A12.7","Objective":"Information systems audit considerations","ControlId":"12.7.1","Control":"Information systems audit controls"}]

children.value: Is there a coordination structure or a procedure enabling information security managers to define the annual audit program or to participate in its definition?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A12","Clause":"Operations security","ObjectiveId":"A12.7","Objective":"Information systems audit considerations","ControlId":"12.7.1","Control":"Information systems audit controls"}]

children.value: Is the CISO informed of the audit results which concern information systems security?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A12","Clause":"Operations security","ObjectiveId":"A12.7","Objective":"Information systems audit considerations","ControlId":"12.7.1","Control":"Information systems audit controls"}]

children.value: Is the CISO informed of summary audit results not specifically related to information systems security and does (s)he have access to corresponding detailed audit reports?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A12","Clause":"Operations security","ObjectiveId":"A12.7","Objective":"Information systems audit considerations","ControlId":"12.7.1","Control":"Information systems audit controls"}]

children.value: Has the annual audit program been presented to and approved by the management?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A12","Clause":"Operations security","ObjectiveId":"A12.7","Objective":"Information systems audit considerations","ControlId":"12.7.1","Control":"Information systems audit controls"}]

children.value: Is the organization of annual information system audits subject to a regularly reviewed and followed-up dashboard?
Crisis management related to information security

Is there a crisis plan in all buildings which details, as a function of various symptoms, the names and contact details of all persons to notify in order that they may effect an initial diagnosis and, as a function of this diagnosis, the members of the crisis team to convoke and the most urgent actions to carry out?
Is there an alert procedure, distributed to the entire organization, which enables directly or indirectly (via surveillance personnel) to contact the various persons likely to initiate a crisis plan?
Does the crisis plan describe in detail the major crisis situations linked to information systems and does it address issues specific to them?
Does the crisis plan include the implementation of corresponding logistical means (equipped war room, communications etc.)?
Are there tools or procedures which enable the updating of the crisis plan and is this updating audited?

Obligations and responsibilities of personnel and management
This includes all staff, internal and external (temporary contractors, trainees, etc.)
Are the responsibilities and obligations of staff with regard to the usage, preservation, archiving and non disclosure of information detailed in a memo or document available to management?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A7","Clause":"Human resource security","ObjectiveId":"A7.2","Objective":"During employment","ControlId":"7.2.1","Control":"Management responsibilities"}]

children.value: Does this document specify the personnel`s duties and responsibilities regarding the use and protection of the authentication means (passwords, keys, tokens, badges, etc.) at its disposal?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A9","Clause":"Access control","ObjectiveId":"A9.3","Objective":"User responsibilities","ControlId":"9.3.1","Control":"Use of secret authentication information"}]

children.value: Do the personnel`s duties and responsibilities specify how to react when the workstation is left vacant (logout, logoff, screen savers, lock-out, etc.) ?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A11","Clause":"Physical and environmental security","ObjectiveId":"A11.2","Objective":"Equipment","ControlId":"11.2.8","Control":"Unattended user equipment"}]

children.value: Are the obligations and responsibilities of personnel related to the usage and protection of assets and resources belonging to the company detailed in a memo or document available to management?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A8","Clause":"Asset management","ObjectiveId":"A8.2","Objective":"Information classification","ControlId":"8.2.3","Control":"Handling of assets"}]

children.value: Does this document detail what is tolerated and the limits that cannot be disregarded (personal use of company possessions for example)?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A8","Clause":"Asset management","ObjectiveId":"A8.1","Objective":"Responsibility for assets","ControlId":"8.1.3","Control":"Acceptable use of assets"}]

children.value: Does this document detail the course of action in case of excess or abuse?
Is there a formal disciplinary process to cover a breach to security rules or infringement of procedure?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A7","Clause":"Human resource security","ObjectiveId":"A7.2","Objective":"During employment","ControlId":"7.2.3","Control":"Disciplinary process"}]

children.value: Are the obligations and responsibilities of management in the domain of protection of information and of company resources detailed in a document distributed to all staff managers?

Are the Management`s duties and responsibilities at the time of an employee`s termination or change of functions (internal or contract) defined and specified by a procedure or a document disclosed to all the managers ?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A7","Clause":"Human resource security","ObjectiveId":"A7.3","Objective":"Termination and change of employment","ControlId":"7.3.1","Control":"Termination or change of employment responsibilities"}]

children.value: Does the previous procedure (or the equivalent document) cover the questioning and deletion of access rights to all relevant parts of the information system?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A9","Clause":"Access control","ObjectiveId":"A9.2","Objective":"User access management","ControlId":"9.2.6","Control":"Removal or adjustment of access rights"}]

children.value: Are all documents or charters concerning staff obligations and responsibilities authenticated?
Are the Managers ensuring and held accountable for their colleagues` compliance to the policies and standards in force?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A18","Clause":"Compliance","ObjectiveId":"A18.2","Objective":"Information security reviews","ControlId":"18.2.2","Control":"Compliance with security policies and standards"}]

children.value: Is there a regular review of such documents or charters relating to staff obligations and responsibilities?

answers.Description: The system shall invalidate session identifiers upon user logout or other session terminations
answers.MEHARI_R_V4: This curtails the ability of adversaries from capturing and continuing to employ previously valid session IDs.

answers.Description: The information system shall prevent further access to the system, by locking the session, upon receiving a request from a user.
answers.MEHARI_R_V4: Session locks are temporary actions taken when users stop work and move away from the immediate vicinity of information systems but do not want to log out because of the temporary nature of their absences.

children.value: General directives related to information protection
Is there document defining the general rules for site protection from external threats, the required conditions for access to each site from outside and the protection of sensitive premises?

Is there a document defining the general rules to apply in order to protect the internal network from external threats, the conditions required to access the internal network from the outside and vice versa and the separation required between internal sub-networks?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A13","Clause":"Communications security","ObjectiveId":"A13.1","Objective":"Network security management","ControlId":"13.1.3","Control":"Segregation in networks"}]

children.value: Is there a document defining the general rules applied to the access protection of computing resources (storage and networking elements, systems, applications, data, media, etc.) and the conditions required for the granting, the management and control of access rights?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A13","Clause":"Communications security","ObjectiveId":"A13.2","Objective":"Information transfer","ControlId":"13.2.1","Control":"Information transfer policies and procedures"}]

children.value: Are these rules established according to the concerned assets` classification level?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A8","Clause":"Asset management","ObjectiveId":"A8.2","Objective":"Information classification","ControlId":"8.2.2","Control":"Labelling of information"},{"ClauseId":"A13","Clause":"Communications security","ObjectiveId":"A13.2","Objective":"Information transfer","ControlId":"13.2.1","Control":"Information transfer policies and procedures"}]

children.value: Is there a document defining the rules applied to the usage of computing (networks, servers etc.) and communications resources?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A9","Clause":"Access control","ObjectiveId":"A9.1","Objective":"Business requirements of access control","ControlId":"9.1.2","Control":"Access to networks and network services"},{"ClauseId":"A13","Clause":"Communications security","ObjectiveId":"A13.2","Objective":"Information transfer","ControlId":"13.2.1","Control":"Information transfer policies and procedures"}]

children.value: Is there a document defining the general rules applied to software development and security considerations in project management?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A6","Clause":"Organization of information security","ObjectiveId":"A6.1","Objective":"Internal organization","ControlId":"6.1.5","Control":"Information security in project management"}]

children.value: Is there a document defining the general day-to-day rules applicable to the management of the working environment (documents, workstations, telephone, fax, off-site work)?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A11","Clause":"Physical and environmental security","ObjectiveId":"A11.2","Objective":"Equipment","ControlId":"11.2.9","Control":"Clear desk and clear screen policy"},{"ClauseId":"A13","Clause":"Communications security","ObjectiveId":"A13.2","Objective":"Information transfer","ControlId":"13.2.1","Control":"Information transfer policies and procedures"}]

children.value: Is there a document defining additional security procedures to apply regarding mobile computing and teleworking?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A6","Clause":"Organization of information security","ObjectiveId":"A6.2","Objective":"Mobile devices and teleworking","ControlId":"6.2.1","Control":"Mobile device policy"},{"ClauseId":"A13","Clause":"Communications security","ObjectiveId":"A13.2","Objective":"Information transfer","ControlId":"13.2.1","Control":"Information transfer policies and procedures"}]

children.value: Is there a document setting out the requirements, responsibilities and procedures to apply to protect archives that are important for the company?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A18","Clause":"Compliance","ObjectiveId":"A18.1","Objective":"Compliance with legal and contractual requirements","ControlId":"18.1.3","Control":"Protection of records"}]

children.value: Are the overall regulatory, contractual, and legal requirements explicitly identified, and does their application by the organization appear in an updated document?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A8","Clause":"Asset management","ObjectiveId":"A8.2","Objective":"Information classification","ControlId":"8.2.3","Control":"Handling of assets"},{"ClauseId":"A18","Clause":"Compliance","ObjectiveId":"A18.1","Objective":"Compliance with legal and contractual requirements","ControlId":"18.1.1","Control":"Identification of applicable legislation and contractual requirements"}]

children.value: Are the resources and solutions available to managers and users in line with above documents?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A8","Clause":"Asset management","ObjectiveId":"A8.2","Objective":"Information classification","ControlId":"8.2.3","Control":"Handling of assets"}]

children.value: Are the rules concerning information and resource protection easily accessible to all staff (for example via intranet)?
Is there a procedure to control or audit the relevance and authenticity of the rules, pertaining to information protection and information system resources, distributed to all staff?

answers.Description: The contractor shall apply the procedures from the ESA Security Directives for the accessing, handling and storage of information. These procedures ensures the protection of information from improper use or unauthorised divulgation.
answers.MEHARI_R_V4: For HSO-G, the [applicable Secops Procedure] also apply.

gasf.value: Backup audits on separate physical systems

answers.Description: The system shall backup audit records onto a physically different system or system component than the system or component being audited.
answers.MEHARI_R_V4: This helps to ensure that a compromise of the information system being audited does not also result in a compromise of the audit records.

gasf.value: Prevent unauthorised transfer when switching between classifications

answers.Description: The system shall also prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources when system processing explicitly switches between different information classification levels or security categories.
answers.MEHARI_R_V4: This applies when there are explicit changes in information processing levels during information system operations, for example, during multi-level processing and periods processing with information at different classification levels or security categories. Organisation-defined procedures may include, for example, approved sanitization processes for electronically stored information.

children.value: Classification of resources

Is there a hierarchy or system enabling the classification of information assets reflecting their protection as a function of the context of the organization and taking into account availability, integrity and confidentiality?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A8","Clause":"Asset management","ObjectiveId":"A8.2","Objective":"Information classification","ControlId":"8.2.1","Control":"Classification of information"}]

children.value: Does this categorization scheme define the marking of different types of assets according to its classification?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A8","Clause":"Asset management","ObjectiveId":"A8.2","Objective":"Information classification","ControlId":"8.2.1","Control":"Classification of information"},{"ClauseId":"A8","Clause":"Asset management","ObjectiveId":"A8.2","Objective":"Information classification","ControlId":"8.2.2","Control":"Labelling of information"}]

children.value: Have information sources (documents, data, files, databases etc.) been classified as a function of the impact that a security breach might have on the organization?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A8","Clause":"Asset management","ObjectiveId":"A8.2","Objective":"Information classification","ControlId":"8.2.1","Control":"Classification of information"}]

children.value: Has the classification been effected for each of the criteria availability, integrity and confidentiality?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A8","Clause":"Asset management","ObjectiveId":"A8.2","Objective":"Information classification","ControlId":"8.2.1","Control":"Classification of information"}]

children.value: Have sensitive resources been classified (information systems, telecom equipment, sites etc.) as a function of the impact that a security breach affecting these assets might have on the organization?
Has this classification been effected for each of the criteria availability, integrity, confidentiality?
Have sensitive programs and transactions been classified as a function of the impact a security breach on these assets might have on the organization?
Has this classification been effected for the criteria availability, integrity and confidentiality?
Are these classifications easily available when needed to the staff concerned?
Is there a procedure for regular review of the classifications and is this procedure controlled?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A8","Clause":"Asset management","ObjectiveId":"A8.2","Objective":"Information classification","ControlId":"8.2.1","Control":"Classification of information"}]

children.value: Asset management

Are the types of assets - that need to be identified and inventoried defined?
Assets can be information (databases, files, contracts, agreements, documentation, guides, procedures, plans, archives, etc.), software (applications, firmware, middleware, tools and utilities, etc.), equipment (computers, network equipment, media, etc.), services and supporting utilities (energy, heating, air conditioning, etc.), people or know-how, intangible assets such as reputation or image.

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A8","Clause":"Asset management","ObjectiveId":"A8.1","Objective":"Responsibility for assets","ControlId":"8.1.1","Control":"Inventory of assets"}]

children.value: Is an inventory of the types of assets - as identified and defined herein - kept up-to-date?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A8","Clause":"Asset management","ObjectiveId":"A8.1","Objective":"Responsibility for assets","ControlId":"8.1.1","Control":"Inventory of assets"}]

children.value:
Is an owner appointed for each identified and inventoried asset?
An owner is the individual or the entity appointed to assume responsibility of the development, maintenance, operation, use and security of this asset. The word owner does not mean that the individual or entity holds a property right for this asset.

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A8","Clause":"Asset management","ObjectiveId":"A8.1","Objective":"Responsibility for assets","ControlId":"8.1.2","Control":"Ownership of assets"}]

children.value:
Is an acceptable set of usage rules defined and documented for each asset?

This implies, particularly, defining the private use an employee can make of the company`s assets.

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A8","Clause":"Asset management","ObjectiveId":"A8.1","Objective":"Responsibility for assets","ControlId":"8.1.3","Control":"Acceptable use of assets"}]

children.value: Are the rules regarding the return to the company or organization of assets entrusted to employees at the time of termination or change of functions clearly defined and set forth by Management ?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A8","Clause":"Asset management","ObjectiveId":"A8.1","Objective":"Responsibility for assets","ControlId":"8.1.4","Control":"Return of assets"}]

children.value: Are there rules regarding outside taking of asset (prior authorization, authorized individuals, log for returning or taking asset outside, deletion of unnecessary data, etc.)?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A11","Clause":"Physical and environmental security","ObjectiveId":"A11.2","Objective":"Equipment","ControlId":"11.2.5","Control":"Removal of assets"}]

children.value: Protection of assets having value of evidence
Have the assets that may be used as elements of evidence been identified and itemized?
For each of these assets, have the proclamations that it would allow checking, and the associated checking process?
For each verification process, have the reasons that could foil or weaken the capacity to provide conviction been analyzed?
Have all necessary measures been taken consequently?
Is the aptness of these measures periodically reviewed?
Are these measures periodically subject to an audit?
Staff involvement, contractual clauses
Has a note been distributed to all personnel (including temporary staff) detailing staff obligations and responsibilities such that they cannot deny having received it?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A7","Clause":"Human resource security","ObjectiveId":"A7.1","Objective":"Prior to employment","ControlId":"7.1.1","Control":"Screening"},{"ClauseId":"A13","Clause":"Communications security","ObjectiveId":"A13.2","Objective":"Information transfer","ControlId":"13.2.4","Control":"Confidentiality or nondisclosure agreements"}]

children.value: Is there, within work contracts or within internal regulations, a clause which clearly states the obligation to adhere to the security rules in force?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A7","Clause":"Human resource security","ObjectiveId":"A7.1","Objective":"Prior to employment","ControlId":"7.1.1","Control":"Screening"},{"ClauseId":"A13","Clause":"Communications security","ObjectiveId":"A13.2","Objective":"Information transfer","ControlId":"13.2.4","Control":"Confidentiality or nondisclosure agreements"}]

children.value: Has a note been distributed to all personnel informing them of all legal, regulatory or contractual obligations?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A13","Clause":"Communications security","ObjectiveId":"A13.2","Objective":"Information transfer","ControlId":"13.2.4","Control":"Confidentiality or nondisclosure agreements"}]

children.value: Are the security obligations and responsibilities embodied in contracts (in either of general or specific clauses) of all staff acting for the organization and who for this reason may have or require access to information or sensitive resources?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A13","Clause":"Communications security","ObjectiveId":"A13.2","Objective":"Information transfer","ControlId":"13.2.4","Control":"Confidentiality or nondisclosure agreements"}]

children.value: Are contractor companies, who may have access to sensitive information or systems, obliged to ensure that all staff sign a personal commitment that they will abide by the specified security clauses?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A13","Clause":"Communications security","ObjectiveId":"A13.2","Objective":"Information transfer","ControlId":"13.2.4","Control":"Confidentiality or nondisclosure agreements"},{"ClauseId":"A15","Clause":"Supplier relationships","ObjectiveId":"A15.1","Objective":"Information security in supplier relationships","ControlId":"15.1.1","Control":"Information security policy for supplier relationships"}]

children.value: Is Management responsible to ensure that the personnel, contractors and third parties respect the company`s security policies and procedures?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A7","Clause":"Human resource security","ObjectiveId":"A7.2","Objective":"During employment","ControlId":"7.2.1","Control":"Management responsibilities"}]

children.value: Is there a control procedure validating and authenticating all rules distributed to staff?

answers.Description: The contractor shall apply the procedures from the ESA Security Directives for the accessing, handling and storage of information. These procedures ensures the protection of information from improper use or unauthorised divulgation.
answers.MEHARI_R_V4: For HSO-G, the [applicable Secops Procedure] also apply.

children.value: Management of strategic personnel, partners and providers
Are strategic skills regularly identified in the organization?
Are backup solutions available in the absence of strategic skills?
Are strategic partners and service providers regularly identified?
Are backup solutions ready for the unavailability of strategic partners or providers?
Are these backup solutions regarding internal staff or providers able to guarantee the normal functioning of the organization without major disruption?
Are strategic personnel subject to specific career management?
Are strategic partners subject to a specific contractual management?
Is there a relevant control and update procedure for the preceding measures?
Staff screening procedure
Is there a preliminary information procedure for the personnel (internal or contractual) regarding its duties and responsibilities, and security requirements before any assignment or hiring?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A6","Clause":"Organization of information security","ObjectiveId":"A6.1","Objective":"Internal organization","ControlId":"6.1.1","Control":"Information security roles and responsibilities"}]

children.value: Is screening information collected at time of recruitment of staff likely to be involved in sensitive tasks?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A7","Clause":"Human resource security","ObjectiveId":"A7.1","Objective":"Prior to employment","ControlId":"7.1.1","Control":"Screening"}]

children.value: Have external contractors, working on site on sensitive tasks, been checked for security clearance approval by an official organization?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A7","Clause":"Human resource security","ObjectiveId":"A7.1","Objective":"Prior to employment","ControlId":"7.1.1","Control":"Screening"}]

children.value:
Is additional (clearance) information collected when staff are affected to sensitive tasks?

NB: an open interview may be used in order to avoid placing people in a situation of conflict of interest

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A7","Clause":"Human resource security","ObjectiveId":"A7.1","Objective":"Prior to employment","ControlId":"7.1.1","Control":"Screening"}]

children.value: Awareness and training in security
Is there a program to raise awareness of staff to risks of accident, error or malevolence in the processing of information?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A7","Clause":"Human resource security","ObjectiveId":"A7.2","Objective":"During employment","ControlId":"7.2.2","Control":"Information security awareness, education and training"}]

children.value: Are all staff members trained on a regular basis in security awareness?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A7","Clause":"Human resource security","ObjectiveId":"A7.2","Objective":"During employment","ControlId":"7.2.2","Control":"Information security awareness, education and training"}]

children.value: Is there a program to train staff in the rules and general measures of information protection?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A7","Clause":"Human resource security","ObjectiveId":"A7.2","Objective":"During employment","ControlId":"7.2.2","Control":"Information security awareness, education and training"}]

children.value: Do these rules and general measures cover all relevant domains (documents, computer equipment, premises, systems and application access, telephone, fax, behavior in meetings and out of office etc.)?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A7","Clause":"Human resource security","ObjectiveId":"A7.2","Objective":"During employment","ControlId":"7.2.2","Control":"Information security awareness, education and training"}]

children.value: Are these rules and general measures easily accessible to staff in case of need (intranet for example) and has communication been done on this matter?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A7","Clause":"Human resource security","ObjectiveId":"A7.2","Objective":"During employment","ControlId":"7.2.2","Control":"Information security awareness, education and training"}]

children.value: Do these regulations specify reporting processes for the incidents and faults observed, and how to react?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A16","Clause":"Information security incident management","ObjectiveId":"A16.1","Objective":"Management of information security incidents and improvements","ControlId":"16.1.3","Control":"Reporting information security weaknesses"}]

children.value: Do people with responsibility for security issues receive regular relevant training?
Is there a dashboard detailing the effective implementation of actions related to security awareness and training?
Is there a follow up carried out of the level of satisfaction and compliance of staff related to actions of raising awareness and training in information systems security?

answers.Description: The contractor and third party using the information systems shall report all identified and possible security weaknesses in systems or services used by the project or project outcome. Such reports shall be issued at any time and as quickly as possible to the TO.
answers.MEHARI_R_V4:
This can be any security weakness that is detected during any process of GASF. For example weaknesses can be detected during the development, during the design of the architecture. Such weaknesses shall be reported and reflected in the risk analysis to ensure its coverage or, as last resort, acceptance.
Following actions may expose security weaknesses:
- Secrutiy tools (source code review, tests, etc.)
- Security Events (e.g. the fact that the security event happened is due to a weakness in the system/procedure/etc.).
- Fortuit observation / technology watch (e.g. a weakness was noticed during a review, new information on a weakness)
The following requirements ensure the proper handling of security incidents through an information security incident management.

children.value: Third Parties Management (partners, suppliers, clients, public, etc.)

Have the risks associated with access by third-party personnel (providers) to the information system (in full or in part) or on the premises containing information been assessed, and thus the necessary security measures been defined?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A15","Clause":"Supplier relationships","ObjectiveId":"A15.1","Objective":"Information security in supplier relationships","ControlId":"15.1.1","Control":"Information security policy for supplier relationships"}]

children.value: Have the risks associated with client or public`s access to the information system (in full or in part) or on the premises containing information) been assessed, and thus the necessary security measures been defined?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A15","Clause":"Supplier relationships","ObjectiveId":"A15.1","Objective":"Information security in supplier relationships","ControlId":"15.1.1","Control":"Information security policy for supplier relationships"}]

children.value: Have the risks associated to information or software transfers to a third party been assessed and have the procedures and responsibilities for each party been formalized by contract?

children.value:
Have the overall security clauses been defined, that should be included in each Agreement signed with a third party involving an access to the information system or to the premises containing information?
The information system, including any data support or means of processing, carrying or communicating information.

children.value: People Registration
Are there formal registration and revocation procedures for the individuals?

children.value: Do these procedures involve personnel management and hierarchy?

children.value: Is a unique identifier (ID) assigned to each user (employee, external, etc.) who could have access to the information system?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A9","Clause":"Access control","ObjectiveId":"A9.2","Objective":"User access management","ControlId":"9.2.1","Control":"User registration and de-registration"}]

children.value: Are the rights granted to the users as they register (shared services, messaging, etc.) approved by the owners of the concerned assets?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A9","Clause":"Access control","ObjectiveId":"A9.2","Objective":"User access management","ControlId":"9.2.1","Control":"User registration and de-registration"}]

children.value: Are all users kept informed, at time of registration, of all the vested rights and of his/her duties regarding any adjudication of rights (vested at the time of registration or he/she could be granted afterwards)?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A9","Clause":"Access control","ObjectiveId":"A9.2","Objective":"User access management","ControlId":"9.2.1","Control":"User registration and de-registration"}]

children.value:
Are these procedures controlled and are possible defects documented and corrected in real time?

The responsiveness of the managerial chain must forbid exception procedures that may result from delays with (de)registration processes.

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A9","Clause":"Access control","ObjectiveId":"A9.2","Objective":"User access management","ControlId":"9.2.1","Control":"User registration and de-registration"}]

answers.Description: The user ID used to identify a user in the system shall be unique.

children.value: Insurance against property (or material) damages

Are information systems covered by an insurance policy which accounts for material damage (fire damage, miscellaneous risks and accidents, damage to machines, all computing risks, all risks except, named risks etc.)?
Does the insurance policy cover all computer and telecommunications systems, cabling and computer rooms?

Does the insurance policy cover all usual causes of disaster: accident (fire, water damage, lightning etc.), human error, sabotage, vandalism (including by company personnel or third party engaged in operations, maintenance or upkeep)?
Does the insurance policy cover (real) costs of information system re-initialization incurred by a disaster (installation, restart and system test, data and media reconstruction)?
Does the insurance policy cover all additional operational costs (continuing expenses and fees, avoid or limit halting of work activity)?
Does the insurance policy cover costs incurred by the company in order to re-establish its image with clients or partners?
Does the insurance policy cover the global losses incurred by the disaster?
Is the coverage of computer and information system (exclusions, guarantees) decided jointly with Information Technology management and updated regularly?
Does the level of guarantee and deductible cover the survival of the company in the case of a disaster?
Does the level of guarantee and deductible allow the company to survive a disaster without major consequences?
Insurance of consequential losses (non-material damages)
Are the information systems covered by an insurance policy which covers non material damage (malevolence, non authorized usage, accidental loss of data or programs, denial of service)?
Does this policy cover all computer systems (internal systems, intranet, extranet, web sites etc.)?

Does the contract cover the usual causes of this type of damages: accident (breakage, bugs etc.), human error (data entry errors, programming errors etc.), malicious entry (frauds, intrusions, service denial, including company personnel or third party responsible for its operation or maintenance)?
Does this contract cover all (real) costs of investigation and research of the causes and consequences of the disaster?
Does the insurance contract cover (real) costs of re-initialization of information systems affected by the disaster (restart costs and cost of tests following restart, costs of data reconstruction)?
Does this contract cover all additional operating costs (cover of costs and expenses liabilities, costs incurred to limit operational shutdown)?
Does the insurance policy cover additional costs incurred by the organization to re-establish its image with clients or partners?
Does the policy cover  overall loss of turnover incurred due to the disaster?
Is the choice of computer and information system cover (exclusions, guarantees) decided jointly with Information Technology management and reviewed regularly?
Does the level of guarantee and deductible cover the survival of the company in the case of a disaster?
Does the level of guarantee and deductible allow the company to survive a disaster without major consequences?
Personal Liability Insurance (PLI)
Is the organization covered by personal liability insurance including the consequences of computer disasters (Professional Liability, Product Personal Liability)?

Does the contract cover the usual causes of this type of damages: accident (breakage, bugs etc.), human error (data entry errors, programming errors etc.), malicious entry (frauds, intrusions, service denial, including company personnel or third party responsible for its operation or maintenance)?
Does the insurance policy cover additional costs incurred by the organization to re-establish its image with clients or partners?
Is the choice of computer and information system cover (exclusions, guarantees) decided jointly with Information Technology management and reviewed regularly?
Does the level of guarantee and deductible cover the survival of the company in the case of a disaster?
Does the level of guarantee and deductible allow the company to survive a disaster without major consequences?
Insurance against loss of Key Personnel
Is the organization covered by insurance covering exposure to loss of key personnel?
Does the contract cover all possible causes of loss of key personnel such as airplane or automobile accidents, illness, individual or group resignation?
Does the insurance policy cover additional running costs incurred by loss of key personnel?
Does the insurance policy cover additional costs incurred by the organization to re-establish its image with clients or partners?
Does the insurance policy cover operational losses incurred by the disaster?
Is the choice of computer and information system cover (exclusions, deductibles) decided jointly with Information Technology management and updated regularly?
Does the level of guarantee and deductibles cover the survival of the company in the case of a disaster?
Does the level of guarantee and deductibles allow the company to survive a disaster without major consequences?
Management of insurance contracts
Is there a person responsible for the insurances within the organization?

Is the level of guarantee for IT related assets  the result of a specific study made in conjunction with the IT department (on the basis of a risk analysis carried out recently -within less than three years)?

Is there a regular check (at least once per year) of the insurance contracts by the insurance manager, in consultation with the relevant sector managers, with an adjustment of the cover with the broker or insurance agent if required?

Is there a regular check (at least once per year) of the insurance contracts by the insurance manager, in consultation with the relevant sector managers, with an adjustment of the cover with the broker or insurance agent if required?
Do the relevant sector managers participate in the study of the coverage limits (exclusions, deductible, ceiling, etc) defined in the contracts?

Has there been an analysis of the transfer of risks depending to the various types of partners ?
E.g. service and product providers, hosting services, clients
Taking into account the need for business continuity

Has an analysis been carried out of the criticality of applications in order to underscore the requirements of service continuity?
An in-depth analysis supposes that a list of incidents or failure scenarios and all the foreseeable consequences is established

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A17","Clause":"Information security aspects of business continuity management","ObjectiveId":"A17.1","Objective":"Information security continuity","ControlId":"17.1.1","Control":"Planning information security continuity"}]

children.value: Has this analysis allowed the minimum service requirements to be defined for each application and system and have these minimum service requirements been accepted by the users (information owners)?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A17","Clause":"Information security aspects of business continuity management","ObjectiveId":"A17.1","Objective":"Information security continuity","ControlId":"17.1.1","Control":"Planning information security continuity"}]

children.value: Are there processes, regularly implemented, for risk analysis linked to information, possibly leading to a disruption of the company activities and thus a definition of the security requirements, responsibilities, procedures to apply and implement to allow the development of a business continuity plan?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A17","Clause":"Information security aspects of business continuity management","ObjectiveId":"A17.1","Objective":"Information security continuity","ControlId":"17.1.2","Control":"Implementing information security continuity"}]

children.value: Business continuity Plans
Have Business Continuity Plans (BCP) been designed, from a criticality analysis, for each critical activity?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A17","Clause":"Information security aspects of business continuity management","ObjectiveId":"A17.1","Objective":"Information security continuity","ControlId":"17.1.2","Control":"Implementing information security continuity"}]

children.value: Do these plans foresee all measures to undertake to ensure business continuity between the alert and the eventual implementation of alternative solutions set forth by the technical Disaster Recovery plans?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A17","Clause":"Information security aspects of business continuity management","ObjectiveId":"A17.1","Objective":"Information security continuity","ControlId":"17.1.2","Control":"Implementing information security continuity"}]

children.value: Do these plans cover all organizational aspects related to the manual continuity solution  (personnel, logistics, coaching, etc.)?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A17","Clause":"Information security aspects of business continuity management","ObjectiveId":"A17.1","Objective":"Information security continuity","ControlId":"17.1.2","Control":"Implementing information security continuity"}]

children.value: Have instructions and training been given to implied personnel for the operation of the continuity plans?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A17","Clause":"Information security aspects of business continuity management","ObjectiveId":"A17.1","Objective":"Information security continuity","ControlId":"17.1.2","Control":"Implementing information security continuity"}]

children.value: Do the business continuity plans include procedures for returning to normal activity?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A17","Clause":"Information security aspects of business continuity management","ObjectiveId":"A17.1","Objective":"Information security continuity","ControlId":"17.1.2","Control":"Implementing information security continuity"}]

children.value: Is there a crisis trigger plan associated with each of these plans?

Does implementation of these plans result in an acceptable level (impact limited to 2) of all critical malfunctions?

This question is intended to insure that the effectiveness of this service is not overstated.
Is there a manager responsible for the creation, monitoring, and testing of these plans?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A17","Clause":"Information security aspects of business continuity management","ObjectiveId":"A17.1","Objective":"Information security continuity","ControlId":"17.1.2","Control":"Implementing information security continuity"},{"ClauseId":"A17","Clause":"Information security aspects of business continuity management","ObjectiveId":"A17.1","Objective":"Information security continuity","ControlId":"17.1.3","Control":"Verify, review and evaluate information security continuity"}]

children.value: Are these plans tested regularly (at least once a year)?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A17","Clause":"Information security aspects of business continuity management","ObjectiveId":"A17.1","Objective":"Information security continuity","ControlId":"17.1.2","Control":"Implementing information security continuity"},{"ClauseId":"A17","Clause":"Information security aspects of business continuity management","ObjectiveId":"A17.1","Objective":"Information security continuity","ControlId":"17.1.3","Control":"Verify, review and evaluate information security continuity"}]

children.value: Are the test results analyzed by management and the relevant stakeholders?

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A17","Clause":"Information security aspects of business continuity management","ObjectiveId":"A17.1","Objective":"Information security continuity","ControlId":"17.1.2","Control":"Implementing information security continuity"},{"ClauseId":"A17","Clause":"Information security aspects of business continuity management","ObjectiveId":"A17.1","Objective":"Information security continuity","ControlId":"17.1.3","Control":"Verify, review and evaluate information security continuity"}]

children.value:
Are the business continuity plans updated regularly?
An update should be required to take account of changes in personnel concerned, technical changes, or the results of tests.

answers.MEHARI_ISO13_info: [{"ClauseId":"A17","Clause":"Information security aspects of business continuity management","ObjectiveId":"A17.1","Objective":"Information security continuity","ControlId":"17.1.2","Control":"Implementing information security continuity"},{"ClauseId":"A17","Clause":"Information security aspects of business continuity management","ObjectiveId":"A17.1","Objective":"Information security continuity","ControlId":"17.1.3","Control":"Verify, review and evaluate information security continuity"}]

children.value: Are updates to plans audited regularly (at least once a year)?
Workplace Recovery Plans (WRP)
Are there recovery solutions to reduce the impact if the work environment is not available (workplace unavailable, power outage, telephone outage, etc)?
Are these solutions described in detail in the Workplace Recovery Plans (WRP), including trigger rules, actions to take, priorities, people to mobilize and their contact details?
Are these plans tested at least once a year?
Is the case of failure or non-availability of a crisis solution envisaged, and for each case is there a secondary backup plan?
Are the recovery solutions usable for an unlimited period of time, and if not, has a second solution been identified to replace the initial solution after a predetermined time period?
Is the existence, relevance, and activation of the WRP audited regularly?
